alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 3:19PM EST until December 23 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM FRIDAY TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Two-day snow accumulations through Saturday will range from 10 to 20 inches over higher terrain near Lake Superior and will taper off to 4 to 9 inches for areas from Gwinn south to Watson. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph, especially along Lake Superior. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches into this evening. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, from 1 AM Friday to 7 PM EST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could become difficult to impossible by Friday. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning or evening commute on Friday. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches and cause power outages.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
